title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993". It pertains to conveyance vessels. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to convey two vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. The organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. The Secretary of Transportation can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The organizations must sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. Amounts returned to the United States shall be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary shall deliver each vessel at its location without cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires on a specified date. The Secretary can convey vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The authority to convey vessels expires two years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels, including ABORIGINAL, AFTERSAIL, ALEXANDRIA, AMANDA, ARBITRAGE II, ARIEL, BRANDARIS, COMPASS ROSE, DIXIE, ELISSA, EMERALD PRINCESS, ENTERPRISE, and EUROPA STAR. The curr_chunk lists various vessels with their official registration numbers, including GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, and MARINER. The curr_chunk lists various vessels with their official registration numbers, including MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, and SWELL DANCER. The text chunk lists vessels with official registration numbers and grants permission for foreign-flag vessel H851 to engage in coastwise trade. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL if it undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard, the cost of which is more than 3 times the purchase value before the conversion, completed before June 30, 1995, and the person documenting the vessel contracts to construct an additional vessel within 12 months. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with various endorsements for specific vessels, allowing for exceptions to certain laws and agreements regarding vessel ownership and documentation. The vessel AMY CHOUEST (United States official number 995631) is deemed to be less than 500 gross tons for purposes of the maritime laws of the United States, allowing for sale to non-US citizens and transfer to foreign registry. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel for nautical charting and marine safety improvements. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
